intro: Hieracium doronicifolium seneppense, commonly known as the Seneppense hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy structure. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This species is often found in sunny areas and can spread through both seeds and vegetative means.
